newsitem.title: LEBANON: Israeli planes attack guerrilla targets in Lebanon.
newsitem.headline: Israeli planes attack guerrilla targets in Lebanon.

text.p: Israeli planes rocketed suspected Moslem guerrilla targets in south Lebanon on Wednesday, Lebanese security sources said.
They said the air raid targeted Iqlim al-Toufah ridge used by pro-Iranian Hizbollah guerrillas to wage attacks on Israeli forces occupying a border zone to the south.
"Two planes fired a rocket each into the Iqlim," one source said.
There was no immediate word on casualties in the air raid, the 12th into Lebanon since the start of the year.
The sources said Lebanese army and Hizbollah gunners opened up fire from anti-aircraft weapons at the attacking jets but none were hit.

Hizbollah (Party of God) is fighting to oust some 1,000 Israeli troops and the 3,000-strong allied South Lebanon Army (SLA) militia holding the south Lebanon zone set up by Israel in 1985 to protect its northern border area from guerrilla raids.
